729021f-a.title: Richmond: Innis Street - John Street
729021f-a.text:
(1)
100-102 Innis Street, at the S. W. corner of John Street (left),
whowing Elm Hall.
May 22, 1929
P. L. Sperr,
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
(2)
A view of the rear and east side of the Hall, as seen from
Nnear the entrance to the old John Street stone quarry.
March 24, 1928.
P. L. Sperr,
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
729021f-a.folder: Innis Street & John Street, Staten Island, NY

729046f-c.title: Richmond: John Street - Innis Street
729046f-c.text:
(1)
John Street, slightly south of Innis Street, showing the old
John Street stone quarry on the Bennett property. The quarry was
later filled in.
February 1925.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
(2)
Another view of the quarry.
February 1925.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
(3)
A view eastward across the dumps which filled in the quarry.
The view is toward Trantor Place.
March 22, 1930.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIO4S.
729046f-c.folder: John Street & Innis Street, Staten Island, NY

729045f-c.title: Richmond: John Street - Innis Street
729045f-c.text:
John Street, slightly south of Innis Street,
showing, in a set of three vie~s, the John Street
cuarry on the Bennett property. Views 2 and 3 show
the quarry heing filled in with garbage. The Bayonne
Bridce was later constructed across this area.
February, 1925
Views 1,2,3
P. L. Sperr

729047f-a.title: Richmond: John Street - Innis Street
729047f-a.text:
(1)
John Street, slightly south of Innis Street, showing the dumps
which filled in the old John Street stone 4uarry, on the Bennett
property. The view is northeastward toward Port Richmond High School.
March 24, 1928.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
(2)
North across the edge of the duarry, near John and Imnis Street.
March 24, 1928.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
(3)
A more extensive view across the dumps which filled in the old
stone quarry.
March 24, 1928.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
